sourcing.instructions: Cd (Cadmium) - Obtain from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces; Ce (Cerium) - Available from rare earth element suppliers; Co (Cobalt) - Purchase from metal suppliers; Er (Erbium) - Sourced from specialized chemical distributors.
steps: Cd (Cadmium) - Obtain from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces; Ce (Cerium) - Available from rare earth element suppliers; Co (Cobalt) - Purchase from metal suppliers; Er (Erbium) - Sourced from specialized chemical distributors.

1. Weigh each material accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, add the Cd followed by the Ce, Co, and Er in the specified order. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powdered ingredients until a homogeneous blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each material accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, add the Cd followed by the Ce, Co, and Er in the specified order. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powdered ingredients until a homogeneous blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat to 800째C at a rate of 5째C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat to 800째C at a rate of 5째C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 4-6 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 4-6 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any irregularities or defects. 3. If needed, use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 4. Seal the finished sample with a clear acrylic sealant to enhance durability and surface finish.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any irregularities or defects. 3. If needed, use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 4. Seal the finished sample with a clear acrylic sealant to enhance durability and surface finish.
